---
title: "User Guide"
---

This guide covers all the features of Quarto Wizard and how to use them effectively.

## Features Overview

Quarto Wizard provides several key features:

- **[Explorer View](explorer-view.qmd)**: A dedicated sidebar view for managing installed extensions.
- **[Install Extensions](install-extensions.qmd)**: Browse and install extensions from the registry.
- **[Use Templates](use-templates.qmd)**: Quick-start documents with pre-configured templates.
- **[Reproducible Documents](reprex.qmd)**: Create minimal reproducible examples.

## Accessing Quarto Wizard

There are several ways to access Quarto Wizard features:

### Command Palette

1. Open the Command Palette (`Ctrl+Shift+P` or `Cmd+Shift+P` on macOS).
2. Type "Quarto Wizard" to see all available commands.

### Activity Bar

Click the Quarto Wizard icon in the Activity Bar (sidebar) to open the Extensions Installed view.

### Context Menu

Right-click in the Explorer or Editor to access Quarto Wizard commands from the context menu.

## Quick Actions

| Action | Command |
|--------|---------|
| Install extensions | `Quarto Wizard: Install Extensions` |
| Use a template | `Quarto Wizard: Use Template` |
| Create a reprex | `Quarto Wizard: Quarto Reproducible Document` |
| View logs | `Quarto Wizard: Show Quarto Wizard Log Output` |
